Arch Linux is an independent, open‑source Linux distribution that follows a rolling‑release model, meaning the system is continuously updated rather than released in fixed versions [[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arch_Linux).  It is deliberately minimal: the base installation provides only a bare‑bones environment, and users add and configure every component they need during installation [[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arch_Linux).  Package management is handled by **pacman**, which resolves dependencies and updates the official repositories, while the community‑driven Arch User Repository (AUR) offers additional or alternative packages that can be built manually or via AUR helpers such as yay or paru [[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arch_Linux)[[16]](https://www.tecmint.com/arch-linux-package-management/).  Arch was first released on 11 March 2002 by Judd “ZeroFlux” Vinet, who stepped down in October 2007 and handed the project to Aaron Griffin [[2]](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/linux-unix/what-is-arch-linux/).  The distribution switched to **systemd** as its init system in 2012 and discontinued i686 (32‑bit) support in November 2017, with the community‑maintained Arch Linux 32 continuing support for older hardware [[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arch_Linux).  Because of its KISS (Keep It Simple, Stupid) philosophy, Arch is popular among experienced users who value full control, up‑to‑date software, and a highly documented ecosystem centered on the Arch Wiki [[4]](https://www.webasha.com/blog/what-is-arch-linux-a-powerful-and-customizable-linux-distribution-features-differences-and-real-world-applications).

## Sources

[1] Arch Linux - Wikipedia - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arch_Linux
[2] What is Arch Linux? - GeeksforGeeks - https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/linux-unix/what-is-arch-linux/
[4] What is Arch Linux? A Powerful and Customizable Linux Distribution – Features, Differences, and Real-World Applications - Web Asha Technologies - https://www.webasha.com/blog/what-is-arch-linux-a-powerful-and-customizable-linux-distribution-features-differences-and-real-world-applications
[16] How to Use Pacman and AUR Helpers on Arch Linux - https://www.tecmint.com/arch-linux-package-management/
